content: stitch purl across the middle stitches to the first wrapped stich by the other stitch marker pick up the wrap and purl it together with the stitch wrap the next stitch and turn row 23 slip the first stitch knit back across your work to your double wrapped stitch pick up the loops of both wraps and knit with the stitch wrap the next stitch and turn row 24 slip the first stitch purl back across your work to your first double wrapped purl stitch pick up the loops of both wraps and purl with the stitch wrap the next stitch and turn repeat these last two row until all 10 wrapped stitches have been worked you now continue to work in the round using the magic loop method knitting both socks at the same time to avoid holes at the heel joint i suggest you pick up two stitches from the gap between the needles each side on the next round then decrease 1 stitch each side on the next two rounds this will get you back to 30 stitches per needle ankle continue to knit to the desired length until you are ready to start the cuff cuff there are many ways to knit the cuff but i prefer the twisted k1p1 rib for this you alternate knit and purl stitches but knit into the back of the stitch on knit stitches this gives a lovely defined effect and a good stretchy cuff the cuff can be any size you want but i suggest at least 20 row bind off to ensure a stretchy bind-off wrap the yarn twice around the needle for every knit stitch sew in ends block soak the socks in warm water for about 20 minutes wring and either lay them side-on flat on a towel to dry or place them on sock blockers 3 congratulations you have now finished your socks please either keep them and enjoy the thrill of creating and wearing them or donate them to socks against suicide they will then be gifted to someone who is vulnerable or has been impacted by suicide what s next now you have mastered knitting socks how about starting a local group at work in the library a café or your local craft shop you have the pattern and video tutorials as support and it s a great way of making new friends and helping spread sock love we need people like you to help make this organisation grow if you have any questions
